newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling strengthens against the dollar.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling strengthens against the dollar.

text.p: The Kenyan shillings strengthened further against the dollar on Wednesday in an active market with large volumes changing hands, dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted a shilling mean rate of 56.82 against the dollar from 56.99 on Tuesday. On the pound, it was posted at an average of 87.97 from 88.02 on Tuesday.
"Shilling consolidation continued on the second trading day as players took short dollar positions with exporter inflows into the market continuing unabated," a commercial dealer said.
"The dollar opened at 56.91.01 but soon lost ground to end the day at 56.75/85," she said.
"The shilling has finally broken through the 57 barrier, with the next resistance coming in at 56.50," another dealer added. "Expect bullish tone for the local unit to remain in the short-term."
Dealers said overnight money market rates slightly tightened to between 11 and 17 percent levels. Sentiment is still seen as main reason for sustained high rates.
